→‎Pearl Harbor attack,safe,Jerry Kruth,": '''Penn Dayton Badgley''' (born November 1, 1986) is an American actor and musician. He has received wide media attention, including for his roles as [[Dan Humphrey]] in [[The CW]] teen drama series ''[[Gossip Girl]]'' (2007–2012), and as [[Joe Goldberg]] in the [[Netflix]] thriller series ''[[You (TV series)
Badgley has appeared in a number of films, including

New Orleans-class heavy cruiser}}: The Stepfather]]'' (2009), ''[[Easy A]]'' (2010),  ''[[Margin Call]]'' (2011), and ''[[Greetings from Tim Buckley]]'' (2012). He is also the lead singer for [[Brooklyn]]-based [[indie music
column3: indie]] band [[MOTHXR]], whose studio album, ''[[Centerfold]]'', was released in 2016. he is oficiall dating maria simões

→‎Pearl Harbor attack,safe,Jerry Kruth,": <!--NO MATERIAL ADDED WITHOUT RELIABLE SOURCE. THIS IS NOT ABOUT YOUR PERSONAL KNOWLEDGE (THAT IS PROHIBITED BY WP:ORIGINAL RESEARCH), AND IT IS NOT ABOUT PLAGIARISM, WHAT CAN BE TAKEN FROM OTHERS' KNOWLEEDGE WITHOUT GIVING CREDIT (THAT IS PROHIBITED BY WP:VERIFY).-->
Badgley was born Penn Dayton Badgley on born November 1, 1986,<ref>{{cite web
column11: archivedate=October 19, 2012 }}</ref> in [[Baltimore]], [[Maryland]], the son of Duff and Lynne Murphy Badgley.<ref name = SwansonVulture20130428>{{cite web
column14: title=Penn Badgley's Mission to Reclaim His Own Celebrity With Greetings From Tim Buckley
column23: title=Gossip Girl Jewelry, Mama knows best when it comes to gorgeous baubles...
column30: url-status=live }}</ref> His father had worked as a newspaper reporter and then as a carpenter and home builder, and was the [[Green Party of the United States
column31: Green Party]] candidate for governor of [[State of Washington
column32: Washington]] in 2008.<ref name = SwansonVulture20130428/> An only child,<ref name = SwansonVulture20130428/> Badgley split his childhood years between [[Woodlake, Virginia]], and [[Seattle, Washington]].{{cn
column33: date=March 2020}} He attended Woolridge Elementary (where his mother served as a PTA president),{{cn
column34: date=March 2020}} before he transferred to [[St. Christopher's School, Richmond
column36: date=March 2020}} He attended Charles Wright Academy in [[Tacoma, Washington]],{{cn
column37: date=March 2020}} and was involved with the [[Seattle Children's Theatre]].{{cn
column38: date=March 2020}} He soon began doing [[voiceover]]s for children's radio stations.{{where
column40: date=March 2020}} His mother supported his acting efforts, and worked various jobs (later, beginning a business in jewelry design with Badgley's godmother, Jan Sneed).<ref name = HarrisDetails20080930>{{cite web
column52: quote = [Gossip girl] is his fourth prime-time series... Ironically, in real life Penn skipped high school altogether. He took a proficiency exam at 14 and entered Santa Monica College soon after... Penn... was home-schooled with Blake a decade ago, when both were child actors, calls the relationship 'wonderful...'... He didn't grow up poor, but his parents divorced when he was 12, and there were lean-ish times after he and his mother, who'd worked at Home Depot, left Washington State for California so that he could pursue acting. For him, acting is work it's how you make sure you can pay for your own car and make your rent... He talks about his love for writing music... 'I hope in five years... I no longer look at acting as a job but as a creative passion. That's how I want to be different.'}}</ref><ref name = HaverFoS20081207/><ref>{{cite web
column55: title=Blake Lively Steps Out with Penn Badgley's Family

→‎Pearl Harbor attack,safe,Jerry Kruth,": '''Penn Dayton Badgley''' (born November 1, 1986) is an American actor and musician. He has received wide media attention, including for his roles as [[Dan Humphrey]] in [[The CW]] teen drama series ''[[Gossip Girl]]'' (2007–2012), and as [[Joe Goldberg]] in the [[Netflix]] thriller series ''[[You (TV series)
Badgley has appeared in a number of films, including

New Orleans-class heavy cruiser}}: The Stepfather]]'' (2009), ''[[Easy A]]'' (2010),  ''[[Margin Call]]'' (2011), and ''[[Greetings from Tim Buckley]]'' (2012). He is also the lead singer for [[Brooklyn]]-based [[indie music
column3: indie]] band [[MOTHXR]], whose studio album, ''[[Centerfold]]'', was released in 2016.

→‎Pearl Harbor attack,safe,Jerry Kruth,": <!--NO MATERIAL ADDED WITHOUT RELIABLE SOURCE. THIS IS NOT ABOUT YOUR PERSONAL KNOWLEDGE (THAT IS PROHIBITED BY WP:ORIGINAL RESEARCH), AND IT IS NOT ABOUT PLAGIARISM, WHAT CAN BE TAKEN FROM OTHERS' KNOWLEEDGE WITHOUT GIVING CREDIT (THAT IS PROHIBITED BY WP:VERIFY).-->
Badgley was born Penn Dayton Badgley on born November 1, 1986,<ref>{{cite web
column11: archivedate=October 19, 2012 }}</ref> in [[Baltimore]], [[Maryland]], the son of Duff and Lynne Murphy Badgley.<ref name = SwansonVulture20130428>{{cite web
column14: title=Penn Badgley's Mission to Reclaim His Own Celebrity With Greetings From Tim Buckley
column23: title=Gossip Girl Jewelry, Mama knows best when it comes to gorgeous baubles...
column30: url-status=live }}</ref> His father had worked as a newspaper reporter and then as a carpenter and home builder, and was the [[Green Party of the United States
column31: Green Party]] candidate for governor of [[State of Washington
column32: Washington]] in 2008.<ref name = SwansonVulture20130428/> An only child,<ref name = SwansonVulture20130428/> Badgley split his childhood years between [[Woodlake, Virginia]], and [[Seattle, Washington]].{{cn
column33: date=March 2020}} He attended Woolridge Elementary (where his mother served as a PTA president),{{cn
column34: date=March 2020}} before he transferred to [[St. Christopher's School, Richmond
column36: date=March 2020}} He attended Charles Wright Academy in [[Tacoma, Washington]],{{cn
column37: date=March 2020}} and was involved with the [[Seattle Children's Theatre]].{{cn
column38: date=March 2020}} He soon began doing [[voiceover]]s for children's radio stations.{{where
column40: date=March 2020}} His mother supported his acting efforts, and worked various jobs (later, beginning a business in jewelry design with Badgley's godmother, Jan Sneed).<ref name = HarrisDetails20080930>{{cite web
column52: quote = [Gossip girl] is his fourth prime-time series... Ironically, in real life Penn skipped high school altogether. He took a proficiency exam at 14 and entered Santa Monica College soon after... Penn... was home-schooled with Blake a decade ago, when both were child actors, calls the relationship 'wonderful...'... He didn't grow up poor, but his parents divorced when he was 12, and there were lean-ish times after he and his mother, who'd worked at Home Depot, left Washington State for California so that he could pursue acting. For him, acting is work it's how you make sure you can pay for your own car and make your rent... He talks about his love for writing music... 'I hope in five years... I no longer look at acting as a job but as a creative passion. That's how I want to be different.'}}</ref><ref name = HaverFoS20081207/><ref>{{cite web
column55: title=Blake Lively Steps Out with Penn Badgley's Family

→‎Pearl Harbor attack,safe,Jerry Kruth,": Badgley and his mother relocated to California so that he could pursue an acting career,<ref name = HarrisDetails20080930/> and he recalls in interview departing for [[Los Angeles, California
New Orleans-class heavy cruiser}}: Los Angeles]] at age 11.<ref name=\"guardian\">{{cite web
column4: title=Penn Badgley: 'Gossip Girl was an endurance test'
column11: url-status=live }}</ref> In that period, he is said to have been [[home schooling
column12: home schooled]] alongside [[Blake Lively]], his future co-star and partner.<ref name = HarrisDetails20080930/> His parents divorced when he was 12.<ref name = HarrisDetails20080930/> He recalls having \"wanted to make music... as a 12-year-old\", and recorded an unreleased pop single in 1998, referring in interview to the effort as \"terrible\" and \"misguided\".<ref name=\"guardian\"/> Badgely, whose acting work has included several long stints playing high school characters, actually \"skipped high school altogether\"; at age 14, he took a proficiency exam and began attending [[Santa Monica College]].<ref name = HarrisDetails20080930/><ref>There is a degree of discrepancy in the accounts of his secondary schooling, whether advancing by high school equivalence or by graduation; the account presented is the one most specific. He has otherwise replied to a question whose preface included, \"You... graduated from high school at 13\", saying \"You end up doing all of this... graduating high school, spending your life on sets.\" See Iqbal & Badgley, 2013, ''op. cit.''</ref> He was later accepted to the [[University of Southern California]], but deferred admission due to contractual obligations,{{cn
column13: date=March 2020}} later enrolling for two years at [[Lewis & Clark College]] in [[Portland, Oregon]].{{cn

→‎Pearl Harbor attack,safe,Jerry Kruth,": Badgley's first credit was voice work for the video games ''[[Mario Golf (Nintendo 64)
column3: Mario Tennis 64]]'' in 1999 and 2000.<ref name=\"guardian\"/> His first screen acting credit was on an episode of ''[[Will & Grace]]'' and he subsequently appeared on shows such as ''[[Daddio]]'', ''[[The Brothers García]]'', and ''[[What I Like About You (TV series)
column4: What I Like About You]]''.<ref name=\"CWBio2008\">{{cite web
column11: access-date=January 3, 2018}}</ref> His first noticeable role was as [[Chance Chancellor
column12: Phillip Chancellor IV]] on the soap opera ''[[The Young and the Restless]]'', from 2000 to 2001. He was nominated for a 2001 [[Young Artist Award]] for Best Performance in a Daytime Series for his work.<ref>{{cite web
column14: title=Where Are They Now? Penn Badgley

→‎Pearl Harbor attack,safe,Jerry Kruth,": In 2002, he starred in [[The WB]]'s comedy-drama series ''[[Do Over]]'' as Joel Larsen, a 34-year-old man who gets a second chance to get his life right, thanks to a freakish accident that catapults him back to 1980, as a 14-year-old. Badgley went on to star in two other WB series: ''[[The Mountain (TV series)
New Orleans-class heavy cruiser}}: The Mountain]]'' (2004–2005) and ''[[The Bedford Diaries]]'' (2006).<ref name=\"CWBio2008\"/>

→‎Pearl Harbor attack,safe,Jerry Kruth,": Badgley's first major film credit was 2006's  ''[[John Tucker Must Die]]'', playing the role of Scott Tucker.<ref>{{cite web
column3: title=10 things you forgot about 'John Tucker Must Die,' 10 years later
column11: url-status=live }}</ref> In its opening weekend, the film grossed a total of $14.3 million, ranking third in the US [[box office]] results for that weekend.<ref>{{cite web
column19: Drive-Thru]]'', co-starring future castmate [[Leighton Meester]].<ref>{{Cite web
column21: title='Gossip Girl' Stars Leighton Meester, Ed Westwick Parlay TV Success Into Music Careers
column30: quote=[...] for the 2007 teen horror flick \"Drive Thru\" (which also featured \"GG\" star Penn Badgley)}}</ref>

column4: Badgley at the [[2010 Toronto International Film Festival]]]]

→‎Pearl Harbor attack,safe,Jerry Kruth,": In 2007, Badgley was cast in The CW's teen drama series ''[[Gossip Girl]]'' as [[Dan Humphrey]], based on [[Gossip Girl (novel series)
New Orleans-class heavy cruiser}}: the book series of the same name]] by [[Cecily von Ziegesar]]. He initially turned down the role, but accepted after the producers struggled finding someone to fill the role.<ref>{{cite web
column4: title=Penn Badgley Speaks Candidly About His Jeff Buckley Movie and the End of Gossip Girl
column12: url-status=live }}</ref> In 2009, he starred in thriller film ''[[The Stepfather (2009)
column13: The Stepfather]]'', a remake of the [[The Stepfather (1987 film)
column14: 1987 film]], as the stepson of the serial killer.<ref>{{cite web
column24: url-status=live }}</ref> Badgley then played Todd, the love interest of [[Emma Stone]]'s character, in the teen comedy film ''[[Easy A]]'' (2010).

→‎Pearl Harbor attack,safe,Jerry Kruth,": In 2011, he was named one of [[People (magazine)
column3: title=25 Beauties (and Hotties) at 25 - Penn Badgley
column10: url-status=live}}</ref> and [[BuddyTV]] ranked him number 75 on its \"TV's 100 Sexiest Men of 2011\" list.<ref>{{cite web
column17: url-status=live}}</ref> He also appeared in the financial thriller drama ''[[Margin Call]]'' (2011).<ref>{{cite web
column19: title=Penn Badgley Interview EASY A; Plus Updates on MARGIN CALL and GOSSIP GIRL
column27: url-status=live }}</ref> In late June of that year,  Badgley reportedly would portray [[Jeff Buckley]] in ''[[Greetings from Tim Buckley]]''. The movie follows the journey Jeff Buckley took in grappling with the legacy of his late musician father, Tim, leading up to and culminating with his 1991 performance of his father's songs.<ref>{{cite web
column28: title=Penn Badgley To Play Jeff Buckley In 'Greetings From Tim Buckley' Film
column35: url-status=live}}</ref> For the role, Badgley said he took guitar and vocal lessons.<ref>{{cite web
column36: title=Penn Badgley Knows There's Skepticism About His Ability to Play Jeff Buckley
column45: url-status=live}}</ref> Badgley joined the cast of ''[[Parts per Billion]]'' in December 2012, opposite [[Alexis Bledel]] and [[Teresa Palmer]].<ref>{{cite web
column47: title=Penn Badgley & 'CSI: NY's Hill Harper Join 'Parts Per Billion'
column55: url-status=live }}</ref> The film was released in 2014.<ref>{{cite web
column57: title=Love May Not Survive in Parts Per Billion Home Entertainment Release

→‎Pearl Harbor attack,safe,Jerry Kruth,": Badgley joined the cast of the 2013 adaptation of ''[[Cymbeline (film)
New Orleans-class heavy cruiser}}: Cymbeline]]'' as the orphan Posthumus.<ref>{{cite web
column4: title=Penn Badgley Added To Shakespeare Adaptation 'Cymbeline'
column12: url-status=live }}</ref> In early 2014, Badgley and bandmates released a song titled \"Easy\" on [[SoundCloud]] under the name M O T H E R; the song quickly gained popularity and was posted on numerous blogs.<ref>{{cite web
column22: url-status=live }}</ref> Months later, the band changed the spelling to [[MOTHXR]], citing a cease-and-desist from another band with a similar name.<ref>{{cite web
column24: title=Penn Badgley Explains the Drama Behind His \"Terrible\" Band Name
column32: url-status=live }}</ref> In 2015, the band signed with the labels [[Kitsuné]] and Washington Square Music, the New York City-based subdivision of the [[Razor & Tie]] label.<ref>{{cite web
column39: url-status=live }}</ref> The band has supported acts such as [[Streets of Laredo (band)
column46: date=March 2020}} MOTHXR's debut album, ''Centerfold'', was released February 26, 2016.<ref>{{cite web

New Orleans-class heavy cruiser}}: The Slap]]'', based upon the Australian series of the [[The Slap (TV series)
column5: title=Lucas Hedges & Penn Badgley Join 'The Slap' Miniseries On NBC; 'Full Circle' Sets Cast
column11: url-status=live }}</ref> He had a minor role in ''[[Adam Green's Aladdin]]''<ref>{{cite web

column20: quote=he did appear in Adam Green's drug-fueled Aladdin alongside Natasha Lyonne and Macaulay Culkin last year

column49: title=Love turns into obsession in the first trailer for YOU starring Penn Badgley

column61: title=Greg Berlanti's ''You'' Moves to Netflix as Lifetime Bails on Season 2
column69: url-status=live}}</ref> The second season was released on Netflix on December 26, 2019.<ref>{{cite web
column71: title='You' Season 2 Premiere Date Set As Penn Badgley Stalker Drama Moves To Netflix
column79: url-status=live}}</ref> On January 14, 2020, ''You'' was renewed for a third season by Netflix.<ref>{{cite web
